issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is not completely described.
resolution.name: Incomplete

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Originally posted by Razique Mahroua on 2011-05-10 13:43:47.223288+00:00

Hi, 
I''m trying for days now to run a custom instance in MANAGED mode.
I've read a lot of documentation to be sure about the way I do it.
I've tried four ways :

uec-publish-tarball
create an image viwth KVM
using debootstrap.
using an already running instance

I'm actually trying to instanciate custom images. The one provided by the canonical stores run fine. Mine don't.
Here is what I did :
1- create a image using KVM
2- attach it an ISO (Ubuntu or Debian)
3- connect throught KVM and custom the OS
4- send the kernel and ramdisk
5- remove udev rules and set eth0 to dhcp mode
6- added the part which get the ssh keys in rc.local

Then, I upload my kernel, ramdisk and image, using the euca2ools : 
euca-bundle-image
euca-upload-image
euca-register.

The three elements appear when i run a euca-describe-instances.

When I then run my EMI, here is what i see into the NC log : 

[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] StartNetwork(): SUCCESS return from vnetStartNetwork 0
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] StartNetwork(): done
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] doRunInstance() invoked (id=i-38300704 cores=2 disk=10 memory=512)
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ]                          image=emi-11B41190 at http://172.16.40.246:8773/services/Walrus/templates/debian-6-amd64.img.manifest.xml
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ]                          krnel=eki-4B1F122D at http://172.16.40.246:8773/services/Walrus/templates/vmlinuz-2.6.32-5-amd64.manifest.xml
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ]                          rmdsk=eri-85191311 at http://172.16.40.246:8773/services/Walrus/templates/initrd.img-2.6.32-5-amd64.manifest.xml
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ]                          vlan=6 priMAC=D0:0D:38:30:07:04 privIp=172.19.0.130
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] network started for instance i-38300704
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] retrieving images for instance i-38300704 (disk limit=10240MB)...
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] walrus_request(): downloading /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances//admin/i-38300704/kernel-digest
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ]                   from http://172.16.40.246:8773/services/Walrus/templates/vmlinuz-2.6.32-5-amd64.manifest.xml
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] walrus_request(): saved image in /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances//admin/i-38300704/kernel-digest
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] downloading and preparing image into /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances//admin/i-38300704/kernel...
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] walrus_request(): downloading /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances//admin/i-38300704/kernel
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ]                   from http://172.16.40.246:8773/services/Walrus/templates/vmlinuz-2.6.32-5-amd64.manifest.xml

Then nothing.

All my cloud configuration seems good since i'm able to run, terminate and reboot images for canonical store (ubuntu 9).
There are not any error into the logs, the instance keeps "pending", then terminate.

I've tried several ways to build my EMI (debootstrap, creation from running instance, kvm, uec-publish-tarball) but it's always the same thing.


expected behavior  : custom EMI should be instanciated since i've follow every available way of creating it, and since official ones do work

what happened : state "pending" and not any error in the logs.

Razique
fields.summary: [2.0+bzr1241-0ubuntu4.1] Unable to run a custom instance

comments.body:
Originally posted by Razique Mahroua on 2011-05-10T13:43:47.223288+00:00

Hi, 
I''m trying for days now to run a custom instance in MANAGED mode.
I've read a lot of documentation to be sure about the way I do it.
I've tried four ways :

uec-publish-tarball
create an image viwth KVM
using debootstrap.
using an already running instance

I'm actually trying to instanciate custom images. The one provided by the canonical stores run fine. Mine don't.
Here is what I did :
1- create a image using KVM
2- attach it an ISO (Ubuntu or Debian)
3- connect throught KVM and custom the OS
4- send the kernel and ramdisk
5- remove udev rules and set eth0 to dhcp mode
6- added the part which get the ssh keys in rc.local

Then, I upload my kernel, ramdisk and image, using the euca2ools :

euca-upload-image
euca-register.

The three elements appear when i run a euca-describe-instances.

When I then run my EMI, here is what i see into the NC log : 

[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] StartNetwork(): SUCCESS return from vnetStartNetwork 0
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] StartNetwork(): done

[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ]                          rmdsk=eri-85191311 at http://172.16.40.246:8773/services/Walrus/templates/initrd.img-2.6.32-5-amd64.manifest.xml

[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] retrieving images for instance i-38300704 (disk limit=10240MB)...
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] walrus_request(): downloading /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances//admin/i-38300704/kernel-digest
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ]                   from http://172.16.40.246:8773/services/Walrus/templates/vmlinuz-2.6.32-5-amd64.manifest.xml
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] walrus_request(): saved image in /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances//admin/i-38300704/kernel-digest

[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ] walrus_request(): downloading /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances//admin/i-38300704/kernel
[Tue May  3 17:58:41 2011][017525][EUCAINFO  ]                   from http://172.16.40.246:8773/services/Walrus/templates/vmlinuz-2.6.32-5-amd64.manifest.xml

Then nothing.

All my cloud configuration seems good since i'm able to run, terminate and reboot images for canonical store (ubuntu 9).
There are not any error into the logs, the instance keeps "pending", then terminate.

I've tried several ways to build my EMI (debootstrap, creation from running instance, kvm, uec-publish-tarball) but it's always the same thing.


expected behavior  : custom EMI should be instanciated since i've follow every available way of creating it, and since official ones do work

what happened : state "pending" and not any error in the logs.

Razique

Originally posted by Dmitrii Zagorodnov on 2011-05-25T00:57:19.748841+00:00

Hi Razique,

I am going to close this bug because it is not clear that this is a problem in Eucalyptus. (If you find that it is, based on more evidence, feel free to file another one, of course.)

In the meantime, I encourage you to post this question on the support forum:

 http://open.eucalyptus.com/forums/eucalyptus-support-0

If the last message you see is, indeed,

  "walrus_request(): downloading... kernel" 

I would check cloud-error.log on your CLC to see if Walrus has any errors having to do with decrypting or serving that kernel image. Sometimes, when credentials change there are problems of that sort. (A simple thing to try is to bundle, upload, and register that kernel again and request it via euca-run-instances --kernel eki-xxxxx ...)

Regards,
Dmitrii
